p: A polyphenol, pentagalloylglucose (PGG) ( 45) (Figure 2d) demonstrated anti‐influenza virus activity by reducing virus release, site of virus assembly, and budding (microvillus) and inhibiting hemagglutination induced by the virus (G. Liu et al., 2011). Amplification of the HCV was inhibited by non‐nucleoside inhibitors (benzimidazole scaffold) through inhibition of RdRP, and its mechanism of action was studied (Tomei et al., 2003).
